questions.question: In Strategic Business Architecture, what is the primary difference between an 'Expert-Centric' model and a 'Business-Centric' model?
options: Expert-Centric relies on the practitioner's direct time for all revenue, while Business-Centric builds systems that function independently of the founder.
Business-Centric models focus only on marketing, while Expert-Centric models focus only on clinical results.
Expert-Centric models are always more profitable than Business-Centric models due to lower overhead.
There is no difference; the terms are used interchangeably in the EFT industry.
questions.explanation: A Business-Centric model prioritizes systems, automation, and team-led delivery, allowing the business to scale beyond the practitioner's limited 1-on-1 hours.

questions.question: A non-licensed EFT practitioner is drafting their Informed Consent. To manage legal risk and scope of practice, which of the following statements MUST be included?
options: A guarantee that EFT will cure specific DSM-5 diagnosed conditions.
A clear statement that EFT is not a substitute for medical or psychological diagnosis and treatment.
An agreement that the practitioner will provide emergency psychiatric interventions.
A clause stating that the practitioner is acting as a licensed medical doctor.
questions.explanation: To manage liability and stay within the scope of practice, non-licensed practitioners must clearly state that EFT is a complementary tool and not a replacement for professional medical or psychological care.

questions.question: If an EFT practice spends $1,000 on ads and acquires 10 new clients who each pay $200 for a session, what is the Customer Acquisition Cost (CAC)?
questions.explanation: CAC is calculated by dividing total marketing spend ($1,000) by the number of new clients acquired (10), resulting in $100 per client.

questions.question: When implementing Digital Infrastructure for an EFT practice, what is the primary requirement for a CRM (Customer Relationship Management) system to be considered 'clinically secure' in the US?
options: It must have a gold-colored interface.
It must be the cheapest option available to maximize profit.
It must be HIPAA-compliant and offer a Business Associate Agreement (BAA).
It must allow for social media integration for public sharing of session notes.
questions.explanation: For clinical automation in the US, systems must be HIPAA-compliant and the provider must sign a BAA to ensure the protection of sensitive client health information.

questions.question: In a membership or group program model, which metric is most critical for long-term sustainability and profitability?
options: Churn Rate (the percentage of members who cancel each month).
The number of followers on the practitioner's personal Instagram.
The total number of hours the practitioner spends on Zoom.
The color of the membership portal's login button.
questions.explanation: Churn rate is the 'silent killer' of memberships; keeping it low ensures that the cost of acquiring a member is offset by their long-term recurring revenue.

questions.question: Authority Marketing for an EFT expert focuses on moving from being a 'Generalist' to a 'Specialist.' What is the primary benefit of this positioning?
options: It allows the practitioner to charge lower fees to attract more people.
It reduces the need for any clinical training.
It increases perceived value, allowing for higher fees and more effective marketing to a specific 'ideal client.'
It guarantees that the practitioner will never have to deal with difficult clients.
questions.explanation: Specialization creates 'Authority,' which differentiates the practitioner from the thousands of generalists and justifies premium pricing based on specific expertise.

questions.question: When building a therapeutic team, what is usually the most effective 'first hire' for a practitioner looking to reclaim 10-15 hours of their week?
options: A second senior EFT practitioner.
An Administrative Virtual Assistant (VA).
A full-time lawyer.
A professional videographer.
questions.explanation: Hiring an Administrative VA to handle scheduling, billing, and basic inquiries is the most cost-effective way to free up the founder's time for high-value clinical or strategic work.

questions.question: An EFT practitioner based in the UK wants to scale globally and begins taking clients in the EU. Which regulation must they comply with regarding client data?
options: The US HIPAA regulations only.
The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
They do not need to follow any regulations if they work online.
The Australian Privacy Act only.
questions.explanation: GDPR applies to any business offering services to individuals in the EU, regardless of where the practitioner is physically located.

questions.question: According to the 'Value Ladder' model for scaling, which of the following represents the 'High-Ticket' or 'Back-End' offer?
options: A free 5-minute tapping video on YouTube.
A $27 self-study introductory ebook.
A $5,000 personalized 6-month intensive transformation program.
A $150 single 'one-off' session.
questions.explanation: High-ticket offers are at the top of the value ladder, providing the highest level of transformation and direct access to the expert at a premium price point.

questions.question: What is the 'Ethical Scaling' approach when transitioning from 1-on-1 sessions to group programs?
options: Charging the same price for a group as a 1-on-1 session while providing less support.
Ensuring the group curriculum still delivers the promised transformation and maintaining a safe container for emotional processing.
Removing all interaction with the practitioner to maximize profit margins.
Using high-pressure sales tactics to force clients into the group model.
questions.explanation: Ethical scaling requires that as the delivery model changes, the integrity of the therapeutic container and the efficacy of the EFT intervention remain a priority.
